item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (141 points | 32 comments)
2. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (121 points | 51 comments)
3. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (75 points | 11 comments)
4. Swift 6 (164 points | 51 comments)
5. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (26 points | 13 comments)
6. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (101 points | 37 comments)
7. Instagram Teen Accounts (10 points | 4 comments)
8. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (212 points | 16 comments)
9. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (65 points | 10 comments)
10. Storm Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (16 points | 13 comments)
11. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (73 points | 51 comments)
12. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (185 points | 104 comments)
13. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (176 points | 37 comments)
14. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (10 points | 1 comment)
15. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (401 points | 1139 comments)
16. Krazam: High Agency Individual Contributor [video] (44 points | 6 comments)
17. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (30 points | discuss)
18. Signatures of gravitational atoms from black hole mergers (83 points | 35 comments)
19. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (121 points | 73 comments)
20. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (56 points | 10 comments)
21. Quote Origin: I had exactly four seconds and Google had told me it wasn’t enough (228 points | 94 comments)
22. The Double Irish Dutch Sandwich: End of a Tax Evasion Strategy (3 points | discuss)
23. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (79 points | 54 comments)
24. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (79 points | 26 comments)
25. IBM acquires Kubecost (59 points | 38 comments)
26. A Curried Composition Puzzle (76 points | 9 comments)
27. The theft of a Churchill portrait (49 points | 20 comments)
28. Show HN: Opik, an open source LLM evaluation framework (55 points | 9 comments)
29. Lightweight radio transmitters on birds, bats and insects (56 points | 18 comments)
30. An interactive core memory electronic kit (53 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
